HTBAH.title: How to be a Hero
HTBAH.EffectApplyWarningOwnership: Effects cannot be applied to tokens you are not the owner of.
HTBAH.EffectUnavailableInfo: Source item must be equipped or attuned to activate these
HTBAH.AbilityUseHint: Configure how you would like to use the {name} {type}.
HTBAH.AbilityUseUnavailableHint: There are no uses of this item remaining!
HTBAH.AbilityUseChargedHint: This {type} is charged and ready to use!
HTBAH.AbilityUseRechargeHint: This {type} is depleted and must be recharged!
HTBAH.AbilityUseNormalHint: This {type} has {value} of {max} uses per {per} remaining.
HTBAH.AbilityUseConsumableChargeHint: Using this {type} will consume 1 charge of {value} remaining.
HTBAH.AbilityUseConsumableQuantityHint: Using this {type} will consume 1 quantity of {quantity} remaining
HTBAH.AbilityUseConsumableDestroyHint: Using this {type} will consume its final charge and it will be destroyed.
HTBAH.AbilityUseConsumableDestroyResourc: Using this {type} will consume the final charge off {name} and destroy it.
HTBAH.AbilityConfigurationHint: Configure ability saving throw proficiency, saving throw bonuses, and check bonuses.
HTBAH.AbilityCheckGlobalBonusHint: This bonus applies to all ability checks made by this actor.
HTBAH.ActionWarningNoItem: The requested item {item} no longer exists on Actor {name}
HTBAH.ActionWarningNoToken: You must have one or more controlled Tokens in order to use this option.
HTBAH.ActorWarningInvalidItem: {itemType} items cannot be added to a {actorType}.
HTBAH.ActorWarningSingleton: Only a single {itemType} can be added to a {actorType}.
HTBAH.ActiveEffectOverrideWarning: This value is being modified by an Active Effect and cannot be edited. Disable the effect to edit it.
HTBAH.AddEmbeddedItemPromptHint: Do you want to add these items to your character sheet?
HTBAH.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovement: Allow the player to increase one or more ability scores or take an optional feat.
Maximum number of points a player can assign to a single score.
Drop a feat here to choose one instead of an ability score improvement.
Only features with the 'feat' type can be selected.
Scores cannot be modified with a feat selected.
Number of points that can be assigned to any ability score that doesn't have a fixed improvement set.
HTBAH.AdvancementConfigureAllowDropsHint: Should players be able to drop their own choices into this advancement?
HTBAH.AdvancementConfigureDropAreaHint: Drop Items here to add them to the pool from which a player can choose.
HTBAH.AdvancementDeleteConfirmationMessa: Deleting this item will also delete all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
HTBAH.AdvancementFlowDropAreaHint: Drop an Item here to choose it.
HTBAH.AdvancementHitPointsHint: Track the player's hit points for each level in the class.
HTBAH.AdvancementHitPointsEmptyError: Hit points must be rolled or the average value must be taken.
HTBAH.AdvancementHitPointsInvalidError: Hit points must be a valid whole number.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemChoiceHint: Present the player with a choice of items (such as equipment, features, or spells) that they can choose for their character at one or more levels.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemChoiceLevelsHint: Specify how many choices are allowed at each level.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemChoicePreviouslyCho: This item has already been chosen at a previous level.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelAva: Only {level} or lower spells can be chosen for this advancement.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelSpe: Only {level} spells can be chosen for this advancement.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelHin: Only allow choices from spells of this level.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemChoiceTypeHint: Restrict what Item types can be choosen.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemChoiceTypeWarning: Only {type} items can be selected for this choice.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemGrantHint: Grant the character items (such as equipment, features, or spells) when they reach a certain level.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemGrantDropHint: Drop Items here to add them to the list granted by this advancement.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemGrantContainerWarni: Container contents will not be added with containers.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemGrantDuplicateWarni: That item already exists on this advancement.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemGrantRecursiveWarni: You cannot grant an item in its own advancement.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemGrantOptionalHint: If optional, players will be given the option to opt out of any of the following items, otherwise all of them are granted.
HTBAH.AdvancementItemTypeInvalidWarning: {type} items cannot be added with this advancement type.
HTBAH.AdvancementLevelDownConfirmationMe: Leveling this class down will also undo all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
HTBAH.AdvancementManagerCloseMessage: If the advancement process is cancelled, choices made so far will be discarded and no changes will be made to the actor.
HTBAH.AdvancementManagerRestartConfirm: Are you sure you wish to undo all choices so far?
HTBAH.AdvancementMigrationHint: Select which of the following advancements will be added to {name}.
HTBAH.AdvancementScaleValueHint: A single value that changes as a class increases in level that is made available in roll formulas (such as a Monk's martial arts die).
HTBAH.AdvancementScaleValueIdentifierHin: This scale value for the current level will be available using @scale.{class}.{identifier} in a formula.
HTBAH.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintCR: Use this for representing creature challenge ratings for features like Wild Shape.
HTBAH.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintDice: Use this for dice values like bardic inspiration, sneak attack, or superiority dice.
HTBAH.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintDista: Use this for numerical values that represent a distance, such as unarmored movement speed, or aura of protection radius.
HTBAH.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintNumbe: Use this for purely numerical values like rage damage bonus or number of uses per day.
HTBAH.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintStrin: Use this if you are unsure of the type of the scale values, or if the type does not matter.
HTBAH.AdvancementTraitHint: Grant a character certain traits or give them an option to select traits (such as proficiencies, skills, languages).
HTBAH.AdvancementTraitAllowReplacementsH: If a trait is already set on the actor, allow the player to choose from any other trait as a replacement.
HTBAH.AdvancementTraitChoicesHint: The following traits will be presented as a choice to the player.
HTBAH.AdvancementTraitGrantsHint: The following traits will be granted to the character as long as they don't already possess that trait.
HTBAH.AdvancementTraitModeExpertiseHint: Gain expertise in a trait in which you already have proficiency.
HTBAH.AdvancementTraitModeForceHint: Gain expertise in a trait regardless of your previous proficiency level.
HTBAH.AdvancementTraitModeUpgradeHint: Gain proficiency in a trait unless you already have it, otherwise gain expertise.
HTBAH.ArmorConfigHint: Fill in the above box to override automatically calculated armor class.

HTBAH.Award.Title: Distribute Award
HTBAH.Award.NoPrimaryParty: No primary party set, displaying characters assigned to players instead.
HTBAH.Award.NotGMError: The /award command is only available to GMs.
HTBAH.Award.UnrecognizedWarning: Unable to parse {commands}. The /award command should be used with XP & currencies values such as '/award 10gp 50xp'.

HTBAH.BonusesHint: Define global bonuses as formulas which are added to certain rolls. For example: 1d4 + 2
HTBAH.BonusesInstructions: Configure character bonuses which are added to the appropriate dice roll
HTBAH.ClassIdentifierHint: This class's data will be accessible using @classes.{identifier} in roll formulas.
HTBAH.ClassMakeOriginalHint: First class taken by character used to determine certain class traits when multiclassing.
HTBAH.ContainerDeleteMessage: This container will be permanently deleted and cannot be recovered and the {count} items contained within will be moved out.
HTBAH.ContainerDeleteContents: Also delete all items within the container.
HTBAH.ContainerMaxDepth: Containers cannot be nested more than {depth} levels deep.
HTBAH.ConcentrationBreakWarning: Breaking concentration on an effect that is active on other creatures requires an active GM to be present.
HTBAH.ConcentratingOn: You are maintaining concentration on the effects of the '{name}' {type}.
HTBAH.ConcentratingEndChoice: You are concentrating on effects from more than one source. Pick which effect to end.
HTBAH.ConcentratingMissingItem: The effect that is concentrated on and to be replaced does not exist.
HTBAH.ConcentratingLimited: You are not able to begin concentrating on an additional effect.
HTBAH.ConcentratingWarnLimit: You cannot maintain concentration on more effects!
HTBAH.ConcentratingWarnLimitOptional: You may end concentration on one of your maintained effects to use this item.
HTBAH.ConcentratingWarnLimitZero: You are not able to maintain concentration on any effects!
HTBAH.ConcentrationConfigurationHint: Configure concentration modifiers and bonuses which apply to this creature.
HTBAH.ConsumeWarningNoResource: {name} is designated to consume {type} but no resource is specified!
HTBAH.ConsumeWarningNoSource: The designated {type} source that {name} consumes no longer exists!
HTBAH.ConsumeWarningNoQuantity: {name} has run out of its designated {type}!
HTBAH.ConsumeWarningZeroAttribute: {name} has run out of its designated attribute resource pool!
HTBAH.ConsumeScalingTooltip: If checked, consuming additional resources will increase the level the spell is cast at.
HTBAH.ConsumableLastChargeWarn: This is the last charge of this unit and consuming it will also reduce the item's quantity by 1

Convert.Label: Convert
Convert.Hint: Convert all carried currency to the highest possible denomination to reduce the amount of coinage carried by the character. Be wary, this action cannot be undone.

HTBAH.DamageModification.Label: Damage Modification
HTBAH.DamageModification.Hint: Formulas for amounts that will be added to typed damage applied to this actor. Negative values will reduce the damage taken.
HTBAH.DamageModification.BypassHint: These weapon properties will bypass damage modification for physical damage.

HTBAH.DamagePhysicalBypassHint: These weapon properties will bypass damage resistance for physical damage.
HTBAH.DeathSaveCriticalSuccess: {name} critically succeeded on a death saving throw and has regained 1 Hit Point!
HTBAH.DeathSaveSuccess: {name} has survived with 3 death save successes and is now stable!
HTBAH.DeathSaveFailure: {name} has died with 3 death save failures!
HTBAH.DeathSaveUnnecessary: You do not need to roll death saves because you have a positive number of hit points or have already reached 3 successes or failures.
HTBAH.DocumentViewWarn: You lack permission to view this document.
HTBAH.FilterNoSpells: No spells found for this set of filters.
HTBAH.NoSpellLevels: This character has no spellcaster levels, but you may add spells manually.
HTBAH.FlagsInstructions: Configure character features and traits which fine-tune behaviors of the HTBAH system.
HTBAH.FlagsDiamondSoulHint: Gain proficiency to all saving throws.
HTBAH.FlagsElvenAccuracyHint: Roll an extra d20 with advantage to Dex, Int, Wis, or Cha.
HTBAH.FlagsHalflingLuckyHint: Reroll ones when rolling d20 checks.
HTBAH.FlagsInitiativeAdvHint: Provided by feats or magical items.
HTBAH.FlagsJOATHint: Half-Proficiency to Ability Checks in which you are not already Proficient.
HTBAH.FlagsObservantHint: Provides a +5 to passive Perception and Investigation.
HTBAH.FlagsRemarkableAthleteHint: Half-Proficiency (rounded-up) to physical Ability Checks and Initiative.
HTBAH.FlagsWeaponCritThresholdHint: An expanded critical hit threshold for weapon attacks.
HTBAH.FlagsSpellCritThresholdHint: An expanded critical hit threshold for spell attacks.
HTBAH.FlagsMeleeCriticalDiceHint: A number of additional damage dice added to melee weapon critical hits.
HTBAH.FormulaMissingReferenceWarn: The {property} formula within {name} has references to missing data: {references}
HTBAH.HPFormulaError: The provided hit point formula could not be evaluated.

HTBAH.HitDiceAutoSpend.Label: Auto Spend HD
HTBAH.HitDiceAutoSpend.Hint: Automatically spend hit dice until they run out or health is full.

HTBAH.HitDiceConfigHint: Adjust remaining hit dice levels for each class.
HTBAH.HitDiceWarn: {name} has no available {formula} Hit Dice remaining!
HTBAH.IdentifierError: Identifier can only contain letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes (-), and underscores (_).
HTBAH.InitiativeConfigHint: Configure initiative modifiers and bonuses which apply to this Actor.
HTBAH.ItemAttackFlatHint: If checked, don't add proficiency, ability modifier, or any other bonuses to attack roll except what is included here.
HTBAH.ItemDestroyEmptyTooltip: If this item has limited uses, it will be destroyed when none are left.
HTBAH.ItemRecoveryFormulaWarning: Unable to recover charges for {name}. Invalid recovery formula '{formula}'.
HTBAH.LimitedUsesPromptTooltip: If unchecked, the prompt to consume an available use will be suppressed.
HTBAH.LongRestHint: Take a long rest? On a long rest you will recover hit points, half your maximum hit dice, class resources, limited use item charges, and spell slots.
HTBAH.LongRestHintGroup: Take a long rest? On a long rest group members will recover hit points, half of their maximum hit dice, class resources, limited use item charges, and spell slots.
HTBAH.LongRestResult: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {health} Hit Points and {dice} Hit Dice.
HTBAH.LongRestResultHitDice: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {dice} Hit Dice.
HTBAH.LongRestResultHitPoints: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {health} Hit Points.
HTBAH.MaxCharacterLevelExceededWarn: Character cannot be advanced past level {max}.
HTBAH.MaxClassLevelExceededWarn: Class cannot be advanced past level {max}.
HTBAH.MaxClassLevelMinimumWarn: Class must have at least one level.
HTBAH.ModuleArtConfigH: Configure which module-provided art should be used.
HTBAH.ModuleArtPriorityHint: Use the arrows to adjust the priority of the art sources. When a single Actor has art provided from multiple sources, the one with the highest priority will be used.
HTBAH.Name: Character Name
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepAE: Keep all effects (overrides other effect retention options).
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepBackgroundAE: Keep effects that originate from your background?
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepClass: Keep proficiency bonus (leaves class items in sheet)
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepClassAE: Keep effects that originate from your class or subclass?
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepEquipmentAE: Keep effects that originate from your equipment?
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepFeatureAE: Keep effects that originate from your features?
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepMental: Keep mental ability scores (Int, Wis, Cha)
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepOriginAE: Keep effects that originate from this actor (i.e. effects not attached to features, items, spells)
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepOtherOriginAE: Keep effects that originate from a different actor?
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepPhysical: Keep physical ability scores (Str, Dex, Con)
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepSelf: Keep self (just change image and size i.e. for spells like Disguise Self)
HTBAH.PolymorphKeepSpellAE: Keep effects that originate from your spells?
HTBAH.PolymorphMergeSaves: Merge saving throw proficiencies (take the highest)
HTBAH.PolymorphRevertNoOriginalActorWarn: No original actor was found with reference '{reference}'
HTBAH.PolymorphRevertWarn: You do not have permission to revert this Actor's polymorphed state.
HTBAH.PolymorphWarn: You are not allowed to polymorph this actor!
HTBAH.MovementConfigHint: Configure movement speed and special movement attributes.
HTBAH.NewDayHint: Recover limited use abilities which recharge "per day"?
HTBAH.SaveGlobalBonusHint: This bonus applies to all saving throws made by this actor.
HTBAH.SensesConfigHint: Configure any special sensory perception abilities that this actor possesses.
HTBAH.ShortRestHint: Take a short rest? On a short rest you may spend remaining Hit Dice and recover item uses.
HTBAH.ShortRestHintGroup: Take a short rest? On a short rest group members can spend Hit Dice and will recover item uses.
HTBAH.ShortRestResult: {name} takes a short rest spending {dice} Hit Dice to recover {health} Hit Points.
HTBAH.SkillGlobalBonusCheckHint: This bonus applies to all skill checks made by this actor.
HTBAH.SpellCastNoSlots: You have no available {level} spell slots with which to cast {name}
HTBAH.SpellCastNoSlotsLeft: You have no available spell slots with which to cast {name}!

Warning.Depth: Only three levels of depth allowed in starting equipment.
Warning.ItemTypeInvalid: {type} items cannot be added to starting equipment.

Wealth.Label: Starting Wealth
Wealth.Hint: Formula in GP that can be used in place of starting equipment.

HTBAH.SubclassIdentifierHint: This identifier should match the identifier on the parent class to ensure they are properly linked.
HTBAH.SubclassAssignmentError: {class} already has a subclass. Remove the existing '{subclass}' subclass before adding a new one.
HTBAH.SubclassDuplicateError: A subclass with the identifier {identifier} already exists on this actor.
HTBAH.SubclassMismatchWarn: {name} subclass has no matching class with identifier '{class}'.

ArmorClass.Label: Bonus Armor Class
ArmorClass.Hint: Bonus to the Armor Class set on the summoned creature added to what is specified in their statblock.

Attack.Label: Bonus Attack Damage
Attack.Hint: Additional damage done by the creature's attacks.

Healing.Label: Bonus Healing
Healing.Hint: Additional healing provided by healing abilities.

HitPoints.Label: Bonus Hit Points
HitPoints.Hint: Additional hit points added to the creature on top of what is specified in their statblock.

Saves.Label: Bonus Save Damage
Saves.Hint: Additional damage done by the creature's abilities that require saving throws.

CreatureChanges.Label: Creature Changes
CreatureChanges.Hint: Changes that will be made to the creature being summoned. Any @ references used in the following formulas will be based on the summoner's stats.

ItemChanges.Label: Item Changes
ItemChanges.Hint: Changes made to items on the summoned creature.

Attacks.Label: Match Attacks
Attacks.Hint: Modify to hit values on the summoned creature's attacks to match that of the summoner.

Proficiency.Label: Match Proficiency
Proficiency.Hint: Modify the summoned creature's proficiency to match that of the summoner.

Saves.Label: Match Saves
Saves.Hint: Modify to saving throw DCs on the summoned creature's abilities to match that of the summoner.

Profile.Label: Summons Profile
Profile.Empty: Click above to add a profile or drop an creature to summon here.

Prompt.Label: Summon Prompt
Prompt.Hint: Disable the summoning prompt when item is used. Players will still be able to summon from the chat card.

Warning.CreateActor: You must have 'Create New Actors' permission in order to summon directly from a compendium.
Warning.NoActor: Actor cannot be found with UUID '{uuid}' to summon.
Warning.NoOwnership: You must have ownership of '{actor}' in order to summon it.
Warning.Wildcard: You must have 'Use File Browser' permissions to summon creatures with wildcard artwork.

HTBAH.TemplatePromptTooltip: If unchecked, the prompt for placing a Measured Template will be suppressed.

Subject.Label: Subject Path
Subject.Hint: Explicitly specify a path for the artwork placed over the dynamic token ring. If not provided, the subject image will attempt to be inferred by adding -subject to the end of the normal token image path.

HTBAH.Unidentified.Notice: You must identify this item to learn its details.
HTBAH.Unidentified.Title: Unidentified
HTBAH.VehicleActionsHint: Actions taken with full crew complement
HTBAH.WarnBadACFormula: The provided AC formula could not be evaluated.
HTBAH.WarnCantAddMultipleAdvancements: It is not currently possible to add multiple items with advancements to an actor at the same time. Please add them individually.
HTBAH.WarnMultipleArmor: More than one suit of armor equipped, AC calculation may be incorrect.
HTBAH.WarnMultipleShields: More than one shield equipped, AC calculation may be incorrect.
HTBAH.description: A system for playing the fifth edition of the worlds most popular roleplaying game in the Foundry Virtual Tabletop environment.

EDITOR.HTBAH.Inline.NoActorWarning: No selected or assigned actor could be found to execute this roll.

JOURNALENTRYPAGE.HTBAH.Class.AdditionalE: List of equipment granted by this class if taken at first level.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.HTBAH.Class.AdditionalH: Additional descriptive text displayed beneath the auto-generated hit points section.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.HTBAH.Class.AdditionalT: Additional descriptive text displayed beneath list of proficiencies granted by this class.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.HTBAH.Class.Description: Primary description of the class that will appear first.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.HTBAH.Class.FeaturesDes: As a {lowercaseName}, you gain the following class features, which are summarized in the {name} table.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.HTBAH.Class.HitPointsLe: Hit Points at 1st Level: {max} + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: {dice} (or {average}) + your Constitution modifier per {class} level after 1st
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.HTBAH.Class.NoValidClas: No valid class selected, press the edit button to add a class.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.HTBAH.Class.OptionalFea: The following section contains options {class} features. These features are not granted automatically, and you can choose one, some, or all of them at your DM's discretion.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.HTBAH.Class.SubclassDes: Introduction that will be displayed before this class's subclasses.
MACRO.5eMissingTargetWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' does not have an {type} with name '{name}'.
MACRO.5eMultipleTargetsWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' has more than one {type} with name '{name}'. The first match will be chosen.
MACRO.5eNoActorSelected: No selected or assigned actor could be found to target with macro.
MACRO.5eUnownedWarn: You can only create macro buttons for owned Items
MIGRATION.5eBegin: Applying D&D 5e System Migration for version {version}. Please be patient and do not close your game or shut down your server.
MIGRATION.5eComplete: D&D 5e System Migration to version {version} completed!
MIGRATION.5eVersionTooOldWarning: Your D&D 5e system data is from too old a Foundry version and cannot be reliably migrated to the latest version. The process will be attempted, but errors may occur.
SETTINGS.5eAllowPolymorphingL: Allow players to polymorph their own actors.
SETTINGS.5eAutoCollapseCardL: Automatically collapse Item Card descriptions in the Chat Log
SETTINGS.5eAutoSpellTemplateL: When a spell is cast, defaults to begin the process to create the corresponding Measured Template if any (requires TRUSTED or higher player role)

SETTINGS.5eChallengeVisibility.Name: Challenge Visibility
SETTINGS.5eChallengeVisibility.Hint: Control what roll DCs are visible to the players and whether successess/failures are highlighted.

SETTINGS.5eCriticalMaxDiceL: Make critical hits more deadly by maximizing the values of base damage dice.
SETTINGS.5eCriticalModifiersL: Make critical hits more deadly by multiplying non-dice modifiers in addition to rolled dice.
SETTINGS.5eCurWtL: Carried currency affects character encumbrance following the rules on PHB pg. 143.
SETTINGS.5eDiagL: Configure which diagonal movement rule should be used for games within this system.

SETTINGS.5eEncumbrance.Hint: Enable automatic tracking of encumbrance and the application of status effects for characters carrying too much.
SETTINGS.5eEncumbrance.Name: Encumbrance Tracking

SETTINGS.5eFeatsL: Allow players to choose a feat rather than taking an ability score improvement during class advancement.
SETTINGS.5eHonorL: Enable the use of the optional Honor ability score. Requires the world to be reloaded.
SETTINGS.5eInitTBL: Append the raw Dexterity ability score to break ties in Initiative.
SETTINGS.5eMetricL: Replaces all reference to lbs with kgs and updates the encumbrance calculations to use metric weight units.
SETTINGS.5eNoAdvancementsL: Do not prompt for level-up or character creation choices.
SETTINGS.5eNoConcentrationL: Disable the system's automated tracking of concentration.
SETTINGS.5eNoExpL: Remove experience bars from character sheets.
SETTINGS.5eProfL: Configure proficiency modifier to use a fixed bonus or a dice roll. Reloading the world is required for this change to take effect.
SETTINGS.5eRestL: Configure which rest variant should be used for games within this system.
SETTINGS.5eGridAlignedSquareTemplatesL: When square templates are created as the result of casting a spell or using an item, they will be locked to the grid alignment and unable to be rotated.
SETTINGS.5eSanityL: Enable the use of the optional Sanity ability score. Requires the world to be reloaded.

SETTINGS.5eTokenRings.Name: Disable Dynamic Token Rings
SETTINGS.5eTokenRings.Hint: Disabling the token ring animations can improve performance.

ALLOWSUMMONING.Name: Allow Summoning
ALLOWSUMMONING.Hint: Allow players to use summoning abilities to summon actors. Players must also have the Create Token core permission for this to work.

THEME.Name: Theme
THEME.Hint: Theme that will apply to the UI and all sheets by default. Automatic will be determined by your browser or operating system settings.
